At Xplor, we help businesses thrive by making life simple for daily activities with a recurring nature. We do that by offering smart software, payments, and commerce-enabling solutions across five "everyday life" verticals: Education, Health and Fitness, Boutique Wellness, Field Services and Personal Services

Use experience from a wide variety of platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux) and technologies (e.g. C#, Blazor.NET, Angular, SQL, database design, streaming data platforms and systems, and other languages and technologies as necessary) to accomplish desired business outcomes

Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

6+ years of web development experience. 

BS or MS degree in Computer Science or equivalent. 




 Benefits
Roku is committed to offering a diverse range of benefits as part of our compensation package to support our employees and their families. Our comprehensive benefits include global access to mental health and financial wellness support and resources. Local benefits include statutory and voluntary benefits which may include healthcare (medical, dental, and vision), life, accident, disability, commuter, and retirement options (401(k)/pension). Our employees can take time off work for vacation and other personal reasons to balance their evolving work and life needs. The Roku Culture
Roku is a great place for people who want to work in a fast-paced environment where everyone is focused on the company's success rather than their own. We try to surround ourselves with people who are great at their jobs, who are easy to work with, and who keep their egos in check. We appreciate a sense of humor. We have a unique culture that we are proud of. We think of ourselves primarily as problem-solvers, which itself is a two-part idea. That penchant for action gives us a pragmatic approach to innovation, one that has served us well since 2002.

At Joveo, our mission is to deliver the right job to everyone in the world. We're the global leader in programmatic job advertising, building a new generation of recruitment technology. We are building and deploying state-of-the-art generative AI products, including intelligent multimodal chatbots, screening solutions and GenAI native applications that are seeing mass production adoption. This is an opportunity for a brilliant backend engineer to step into the world of AI. We're looking for a systems thinker with a passion for building rock-solid software and a deep curiosity to tackle new challenges. You will be the architect and builder of the services that power our most innovative AI features.
Your core strength is your engineering prowess. Your mission will be to apply that strength to the unique and fascinating problems of production-grade AI. You won't be siloed; you will have complete ownership of your projects, from a blank editor to a running service in production.

What You'll Do:
Build Production Systems: Architect, build, deploy, and operate highly scalable and available backend services that power our AI applications.
Full End-to-End Ownership: You build it, you run it. Take ownership of the entire development lifecycle, including design, implementation, testing, deployment (CI/CD), and monitoring. You won't be handing your code off to someone else to ship.
Solve Novel Problems: Apply your first-principles of engineering to the unique challenges of generative AI, such as managing state in conversational systems, optimizing for LLM latency, and ensuring data consistency.
Embrace Ambiguity: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where you are empowered to define the path forward, make key technical decisions, and turn ambiguous product ideas into concrete, shippable solutions.
Learn and Innovate: Dive headfirst into the modern AI stack. While you bring the engineering rigor, you'll have the opportunity to learn and work with LLMs, vector databases, evals and AI frameworks on the job.
Collaborate for Impact: Work in a tight-knit team with product managers (or without, if you prefer!) and other elite engineers to build solutions that directly impact our customers and our bottom line.

You are a builder at heart. You find joy in creating elegant, efficient, and reliable systems and are excited by the prospect of learning a new domain.

Strong Programming Foundation: Deep proficiency in a systems language like Python or Java. You write clean, maintainable, and well-tested code. (Experience with Python is a strong plus).
A Fierce Curiosity & Rapid Learning Ability: This is non-negotiable. Prior professional experience with LLMs is NOT required. What is mandatory is a demonstrated passion for learning, a history of quickly mastering new technologies, and a genuine excitement to become an expert in the AI/ML space.
The Ownership Mindset: You are a self-starter who is comfortable with ambiguity and enjoys the freedom and responsibility of a startup environment. You have extensive experience working in large codebases and are skilled at navigating cross-functional dependencies.
Pragmatic and Driven: You have a strong sense of urgency and an ability to deliver high-quality, pragmatic solutions quickly without sacrificing long-term stability.

Why Youâ€™ll Love This Role at Joveo:
The Perfect Launchpad into AI: This is your chance to pivot into the most exciting field in technology. Leverage your elite engineering skills as a foundation and let us provide the problems, mentorship, and environment for you to become an expert in production AI.
Build Things That Matter: The systems you build will be the backbone of products used by millions, directly helping people find jobs.
Radical Ownership: Forget bureaucracy. You will have the autonomy to make critical decisions and see your work go live in production, fast.
A Culture of Builders: Join a world-class team of pragmatic and passionate engineers and entrepreneurs who are focused on solving real-world problems.

Job Title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Backend-Heavy | Agent Deployment Focus)

Location: Bangalore / Hybrid
Company: DecisionX
Type: Full-Time


About DecisionX

DecisionX is pioneering a new category: the worldâ€™s first Decision AI â€” an AI Super-Agent that helps high-growth teams make smarter, faster decisions by turning fragmented data into clear next steps.
From bold bets in the boardroom to cross-functional decisions across Sales, Marketing, Product, and Engineering â€” down to the micro-decisions that power daily execution â€” Decision AI becomes your invisible co-pilot: thinking with you, acting ahead of you, and evolving beyond you.
Role Overview

Weâ€™re looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer with a strong backend orientation to power the intelligence layer of DecisionX. Youâ€™ll be responsible for building scalable APIs, deploying LLMs and reasoning engines, and orchestrating multi-agent systems behind the scenes â€” while also contributing to clean, interactive front-end experiences.
Key Responsibilities

Architect and build backend services that support AI agent workflows, decision logic, and orchestration.
Deploy and manage LLMs and agent frameworks (e.g., LangChain, CrewAI, AutoGen) into production environments.

Implement modular microservices for data ingestion, vector memory management, and real-time reasoning.
Collaborate with AI engineers to operationalize models, build custom tools, and manage infrastructure.
Contribute to modern front-end features using React (Next.js) for delivering real-time decision support.
Ensure security, observability, and performance of deployed models and APIs.

Deep experience with PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or warehouse integrations.
Familiarity with vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Weaviate, Chroma) and embedding models.
Ability to build secure, event-driven systems with queues, WebSockets, or real-time triggers.
Nice-to-Have

Hands-on experience with model fine-tuning, RAG systems, or prompt optimization.
Exposure to CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, and monitoring tools like Grafana or Datadog.
Familiarity with frontend development in React, TailwindCSS, and building agent-facing UI layers.
What Youâ€™ll Get

Ownership of core system architecture at a high-growth AI startup.
Collaborate with a sharp, mission-driven founding team.
Opportunity to push the frontier in agentic reasoning and decision automation.
Competitive salary, early equity, and long-term wealth-building upside.

How to Apply
Email your resume and GitHub/portfolio to careers@decisionx.ai

Primary Purpose: 

The Senior Software Engineer-Master Data Management has a demonstrated track record delivering technically sound, high-quality, innovative, and fully functional software solutions that adhere to coding standards and technical design. This role will research, design, develop and implement new software solutions in addition to enhancing existing software capabilities. This role will also collaborate with other Squad members, stakeholders and the Product team to ensure that products meet business, functional, and technical requirements and are scalable in nature. This will include translating business and technical requirements into well engineered, tested, and deployed technology solutions by gathering user requirements, defining system functionality, and writing code in various languages. The Software Engineer III is responsible for projects from inception to completion including all project artifacts, executive status reports, and supervision of less experienced contributors. This role works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors, deep understanding of the business strategy, operations, markets and key stakeholders.

Our flexible/ hybrid work schedule includes 3 in-person days at one of our core locations and 2 remote days. Our core office locations include Salisbury, NC, Chicago, IL, and Quincy, MA.

About the job
Optomi, in partnership with a prominent telecom and media company, is seeking a Senior Full Stack Developer to join a high-impact initiative focused on building a cloud-native video content recognition and analytics platform. This system plays a key role in ensuring that commercial media meets compliance rules and can be validated, processed, and accessed through a modern web portal. 

This is an ideal role for engineers with deep backend experience in .NET and cloud-native services in AWS, and who enjoy working across the stack with React/TypeScript for UI enhancements.

Project Scope:
Build and extend an internal platform for video content screening and analytics
Process incoming video files using AWS Rekognition to identify and classify content
Help develop the first MVP for an intelligent recognition system that integrates with internal QC workflows
Modernize and enhance an existing UI by integrating it with new .NET APIs
Design backend services and APIs to connect with a custom DynamoDB content library and manage metadata for video ads
Support future development of a client-facing portal to view ad performance and impressions

Tech Stack:
Frontend: React, TypeScript
Backend: .NET 8 (migrating to 10), Windows Services, API integrations
Cloud: AWS (CDK in TypeScript, API Gateway, DynamoDB, Step Functions, Lambda)
Auth: OAuth2
Video processing (nice to have): AWS Rekognition, pre-signed URLs

Breakdown:
70% Backend / 30% Frontend
Strong focus on modern development practices, not legacy support
Mix of new API development, integration work, and cloud infrastructure as code

Must-Have Skills:
Professional experience in .NET backend development (.NET 6 or later, ideally .NET 8+)
Strong proficiency in React with TypeScript
Experience working in AWS environments, particularly with CDK, API Gateway, DynamoDB, and Step Functions
Ability to write scalable, secure backend APIs and integrate them with frontend UIs
Experience working in agile teams, collaborating across functions (product, design, devops)

Nice-to-Have Skills:
Experience working with video processing pipelines or AWS Rekognition
Familiarity with pre-signed URLs for secure media sharing
